events.name: AWSUG November Meet Up
events.description: I'm pleased to announce that we will be holding our next AWS User Group meetup here in the AWS Singapore office on 18 Nov. Despite the usual format being 'First Tuesday', this meeting will be on 18-Nov Expect a similar format to the last couple of meetups, we will be hosting here in the AWS Singapore office again, kicking off at 7pm, Pizza and refreshments will be served. Talks will begin at 1920. We aim to keep them short at no more than 20 minutes each with Q&A at the end. WHAT:  • 1900: Pizza and refreshments • 1920: Introduction, re:Invent Update • 1940: IntoPass: Building a scalable email processing service with Elastic Beanstalk, SES, SNS and S3 (Stephan February) IntoPass is a mail processing service that turns your AirAsia flight itinerary into an iOS Wallet Pass. Users forward their itinerary confirmation emails to IntoPass, and receive a reply email containing their Wallet Pass. • 2010: Amazon Echo / Alexa (tic-tac-toe) demo Run through of building a simple voice activated game with an Amazon Echo WHERE: The AWS Singapore office. https://goo.gl/maps/UzzR2 WHO CAN ATTEND: All are welcome! No prior experience needed. • Anyone who wants to know more about cloud computing and startup companies • Anyone who wants to understand the benefits of cloud computing and how to use the “cloud” to benefit their organization. • Startup founders and aspiring founders COST:  Free! Snacks will be served!
events.location: AWS Offices Singapore, 23 Church Street, Capital Square, #10-01, Singapore - 049481, +65-67220300

events.name: Web Programming with Haskell (DevFest Asia event)
events.description: We plan a Haskell.SG session entirely devoted to web programming. The talks will be shorter than usual, since there are four topics. * Refactoring with Free Monad for testing, Slackbot as an example - Paul Meng</a> * Experience with JSON autotype for parsing web API data, Michal J. Gajda * My first web app in Haskell - Michal J. Gajda (101 talk) * How to make your slides with GHCjs - Paul Meng Please register on the DevFest.Asia page: <a href="https://www.eventnook.com/event/devfestasia2015/home">https://www.eventnook.com/event/devfestasia2015/home
events.location: Microsoft, Level 22 (Conf Room SINOMB 22CF-12), 1 Marina Boulevard, Singapore

events.name: HackerspaceSG Awesome Talks, November 2015
events.description:
This month we have Cheryl Chung from Quad Research and Seth Schoen from the Electronic Frontier Foundation

-----

Cheryl will talk about polling and young Singaporeans and politics.

"Quad Research believes in expanding the space for data-driven discourse and assisting in better collective decisions for Singapore’s future. We bring insight and clarity on how Singapore thinks about herself. We are a non-partisan collective of individuals acting in a personal capacity. We only publish statistically rigorous findings that are of research interest."

https://sg.linkedin.com/in/cheryl-chung-74962140
https://www.facebook.com/cherylzeng
https://www.facebook.com/quadsg/
http://www.quad.sg/

-----

Seth will talk about Let's Encrypt, the new free, automated and open Certificate Authority which is about to make its free TLS certificates generally available for securing communication with websites etc.

Wikipedia: Seth David Schoen (born September 27, 1979) is senior staff technologist for the Electronic Frontier Foundation, a technology civil rights organisation, and has been actively involved in discussing digital copyright law and encryption since the 1990s. He is an expert in trusted computing.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seth_Schoen
https://letsencrypt.org/
https://www.eff.org/
